title: Dylan Alcott and Chantelle Otten arrive at Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala
text:
Paralympian Dylan Alcott and sexologist Chantelle Otten debuted their new romance in April.

And on Thursday, the glamorous couple attended the Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala dinner in Melbourne.

The 28-year-old wheelchair tennis star and disability advocate smiled as he posed on the red carpet with his stunning girlfriend.

Glamour couple: Paralympian Dylan Alcott and his sexologist girlfriend Chantelle Otten attended the Sport Australia Hall of Fame gala dinner in Melbourne on Thursday

Dylan looked sharp in a black and blue dinner suit, which he paired with a crisp white shirt and black bow tie.

Meanwhile, Chantelle was elegant in a white dress which featured a daring thigh split and cut-out detail at the waist.

She completed her look with a pair of strappy heels and a small silver handbag.

Man of the hour! The 28-year-old wheelchair tennis star and disability advocate smiled as he posed on the red carpet

She styled her shoulder-length brunette hair straight and opted for a glossy makeup look consisting of coral eye shadow and a matte lip.

Dylan also posed on the red carpet with other high-profile attendees, including NRL star Cooper Cronk and tennis champion Ash Barty.

The sportsman recently told the Australian Women's Weekly that he rarely wakes up without a smile after finding love with Chantelle.

Fame: Dylan also posed on the red carpet with other high-profile attendees, including NRL star Cooper Cronk and tennis champion Ash Barty

Reflecting on his recent triumphs, he said: 'I love life. I have a beautiful family and a beautiful partner and it's very rare that I don't wake up happy.'

Dylan, whose ABC music show The Set won a Logie Award this year, praised Chantelle for the support she has shown him over the past few months.

'I couldn't have done any of this without mum, dad and [my brother] Zack, and now Chantelle, around me to support and encourage me,' he said.

Black to basics: Meanwhile, other guests at the Hall of Fame gala dinner included newly-engaged swimming legend Grant Hackett and his fiancée Sharlene Fletcher

'People might look at me and feel sorry for me, but don't feel sorry for me! I'm living a better life than anyone I know. Life is awesome,' he added.

Meanwhile, other guests at the Hall of Fame gala dinner included newly-engaged swimming legend Grant Hackett.

Grant, who is back on track after a difficult few years in which his personal life dominated headlines, was joined by his fiancée Sharlene Fletcher.

New arrival: The couple, who got engaged earlier this month, announced they were expecting their first child together in July

The A-team! Also on the red carpet was retired competitive swimmer Kieren Perkins and his wife Karen, as well as surfing champion Layne Beachley

Sharlene wore a shimmering frock which highlighted her trim pins, while Grant looked dapper a black suit.

The couple, who got engaged earlier this month, announced they were expecting their first child together in July.

Also on the red carpet was retired competitive swimmer Kieren Perkins and his wife Karen, as well as surfing champion Layne Beachley.

During the prestigious event, Ash Barty was given the Don Award and Louise Sauvage was also awarded legend status.
